# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input, ' ')
    output = ""
    line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width || line_length == 0
            output *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(output)
            output *= " "
        end
        output *= word
        line_length += length(word) + (line_length > 0 ? 1 : 0) # account for the space character if this isn't the first word on a new line.
    end
    
    return output
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```
